intro: Nigritella corneliana subsp. bourneriasii, commonly known as the Bourneriasii variant of the genus Nigritella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies, and has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its botanical features include a slender stem, showy inflorescences, and fruit that develops into small, dry capsules. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
